page.title: 10Dixon's Works, Newport.
page.content: In the Second World War a factory was built in Parkhurst Forest to construct aircraft fuselages. After the war it was acquired by the J.Arthur Dixon company as a{printing works.Today the company produces {postcards,greetings cards,Christmas {cards,booklets,hotel brochures, {visiting cards and gift wrapping}.Each year Dixons produce about 33 million greetings cards and about 30 million postcards, which are printed on 18 printing machines. Most of the cardboard used is produced in Scotland.Each year Dixons use 550 tonnes of cardboard and they can produce 32 postcards or 12 greetings cards from one sheet of board.Dixons export to 44 different countries and they{employ 240 people.}On the same site there are the buildings of a now closed cigarette lighter factory.
